title: Whoever performs Hajj and does not commit obscenity or commit any evil therein will go back (free of sin) as on the day his mother gave birth to him.
Shall I inform you of the gravest of the major sins?
When a man loves his brother, he should tell him that he loves him

Prayer should not be offered when food is ready, nor when one is in dire need of answering the call of nature
If you said to your companion: "Be quiet and listen" on Friday while the Imām is delivering the sermon, then you would be guilty of idle talk
The one who looks after the widow and the needy person is like the one who fights in the cause of Allah

Trim the mustaches and grow the beards

Avoid the seven destructive sins
O Allah, do not make my grave an idol that is worshiped. Allah's wrath was intense upon a people who took the graves of their prophets as places of worship
The greater the tribulation, the greater the reward. When Allah loves people, He tests them. So whoever who is content, for him is content; and whoever is discontent, for him is discontent
Of all the associates, I am the most able to dispense with association. If anyone does a deed in which he associates anyone else with Me, I shall abandon him to what he associates with Me

The thing that I fear most for you is minor polytheism. When asked what it was, he said: Riyā’ (show-off)

Do not exaggerate in praising me as Christians praised the son of Mariyam, for I am only a slave. So, call me the slave of Allah and His Messenger

Whoever bears witness that there is no god but Allah, alone with no partner, and that Muhammad is His slave and Messenger, that ‘Isa is the slave and Messenger of Allah, and His word which He communicated to Maryam, and a spirit from Him; and that Paradise is true and Hell is true, Allah will certainly admit him into Paradise, regardless of the deeds which he has done
Whoever meets Allah without associating partners with Him will enter Paradise, and whoever meets Him while associating partners with Him will enter Hell
Whoever dies while invoking anything other than Allah as a rival will enter Hell
"Ruined are the extremists!" He said it thrice

Allah's statement: {And said: Never leave your gods and never leave Wadd or Suwā‘ or Yaghūth and Ya‘ūq and Nasr}  [Sūrat Nūh: 23]. Ibn ‘Abbās said: These are names of some pious men of the people of Nūh (Noah)
Whoever guarantees for me to safeguard what is between his jaws and what is between his legs, I shall guarantee Paradise for him

There shall be rulers in charge of you, and you will approve and disapprove. So anyone who hates shall be absolved, and anyone who denies shall be safe, except for those who approve and comply. They said: 'O Messenger of Allah, shall we not fight them? He replied: No, so long as they establish prayer among you
Allah does not accept the prayer of anyone of you who is in the state of Hadath (minor ritual impurity), until he performs ablution
If a person falls ill or travels, he shall be credited with whatever good deeds he used to perform while at home and in good health
The best Dhikr is: There is no god but Allah
Paradise is nearer to one of you than his shoelace, and so is Hellfire
The tooth-stick cleans the mouth and pleases the Lord

Convey from me even one verse, and narrate from the Children of Israel, and there is no sin in that. And whoever intentionally tells a lie against me, let him assume his seat in Hellfire
No fatigue, disease, sorrow, sadness, harm, or distress befalls a Muslim, even if it were a prick of a thorn, but Allah will expiate some of his sins thereby
Hellfire is surrounded by lusts, and Paradise is surrounded by adversities

May Allah have mercy on a man who is lenient when he sells, and when he buys, and when he demands back his money

Whoever goes out to seek knowledge is in the cause of Allah until he returns

If Allah wills good for someone, He makes him suffer affliction
When two Muslims meet to fight each other with their swords, both the killer and the killed are doomed to Hell
Religion is sincere advice

Verily, the lawful is clear and the unlawful is clear, and between them are doubtful matters which many people do not know of. Whoever avoids doubtful matters clears his liability regarding his religion and his honor, and whoever falls into doubtful matters will fall into the unlawful

Verily, Allah has enjoined kindness in all things; so when you kill, kill well; and when you slaughter, slaughter well. Let one of you sharpen his blade and spare suffering to the animal he slaughters

Allah has written down the good deeds and the bad ones. Then He explained it [by saying that] he who has intended a good deed and has not done it, Allah writes it down with Himself as a full good deed, but if he has intended it and has done it, Allah writes it down with Himself as from ten good deeds to seven hundred times, or many times over

Verily, the reward of deeds depends on the intentions, and each person will be rewarded according to what he intended

There should be neither harm nor reciprocating harm

Avoid what I have forbidden you from; and do as much as you can, of what I have ordered you. Indeed, those before you were ruined because of their excessive questioning and disagreeing with their prophets
Whoever does something that is not in accordance with this matter of ours shall have it rejected

O My slaves, I have made oppression forbidden for Myself, and I have made it forbidden amongst you, so do not oppress one another. O My slaves, all of you are misguided except those whom I guide, so seek guidance from Me and I shall guide you

O boy, I shall teach you some words: Be mindful of Allah and Allah will protect you. Be mindful of Allah, and you will find Him in front of you. If you ask, ask Allah; and if you seek help, seek help from Allah
A slave committed a sin and said: O Allah, forgive my sin, and Allah, Blessed and Exalted, said: My slave committed a sin and realized that he has a Lord who forgives sins and punishes for sins

Do not insult the dead, because they have attained the fruits of their deeds

The one who severs the ties of kinship will not enter Paradise
A scandalmonger will not enter Paradise
Whoever loves to have his sustenance expanded and his term of life prolonged should maintain ties of kinship

The nearest a slave is to his Lord is when he is prostrating, so increase (your) supplications (while in this state)

Whoever protects the honor of his brother in his absence, Allah will protect his face from the Fire on the Day of Judgment

Whoever Allah wills to do good to, He makes him comprehend the religion
Verily, Allah loves the servant who is pious, free of wants, and inconspicuous

This world is but an enjoyment and the best of its enjoyments is a righteous woman
Verily, kindness is not to be found in anything but it adorns it, and it is not removed from anything but it makes it defective

Verily a believer attains by his good manners the rank of one who fasts and prays abundantly
Verily, the best of you are those who have the best moral conduct
Allah, the Almighty, said: Spend, O son of Adam, you will be spent on

I am not leaving a trail behind me that is more harmful to men than women
Make matters easy (for people) and do not make them difficult, and give people glad tidings and do not repulse them

When I say: glory be to Allah, praise be to Allah, there is no god but Allah, and Allah is the Greatest

Pray standing; if you cannot, then sitting; if you cannot, then lying on your side

When one of you joins the prayer and finds the Imām in a certain position, he should do what the Imām is doing

O boy, mention Allah's name, eat with your right hand, and eat from what is nearer to you

Take this garment of mine to Abu Jahm and bring me his plain garment, because this one has distracted me from my prayer
The Messenger of Allah (may Allah's peace and blessings be upon him) ordered us to build mosques in different localities and that they should be kept clean

Whoever hears a man inquiring in the mosque about something he has lost should say: "May Allah not restore it to you," for indeed mosques are not built for this

The Messenger of Allah (may Allah's peace and blessings be upon him) spat on the leg of ‘Amr ibn Mu‘ādh when his leg was cut off, so he was healed

The Messenger of Allah (may Allah's peace and blessings be upon him) married her when he was outside the state of Ihrām

The Prophet (may Allah's peace and blessings be upon him) obtained the freedom of two Muslim men in captivity in exchange for a man from the polytheists
I witnessed the Messenger of Allah (may Allah's peace and blessings be upon him) give a quarter (of the war spoils) as extra booty on the way out to a battle and a third on the way back
We used to get honey and grapes (as spoils) and eat them without bringing them (to the Prophet or the one in charge of distributing the spoils)

Whoever believes in Allah and the Last Day should not ride a mount belonging to the spoils of Muslims and then returns it when it becomes skinny out of exhaustion. Whoever believes in Allah and the Last Day should not wear a garment belonging to the spoils of the Muslims and then returns it when it is worn out

We went to the battle of Khaybar along with the Messenger of Allah (may Allah's peace and blessings be upon him) and got spoils there. The Messenger of Allah divided them among us and placed the rest of them with the booty
We received a letter from ‘Umar ibn al-Khattāb one year before his death. He said: Cancel every marriage between unmarriageable relatives from among the Magians
The Prophet (may Allah's peace and blessings be upon him) would hold horse races and would prefer the stronger horses for the longer distances

We asked the Messenger of Allah (may Allah's peace and blessings be upon him) about the fetus (of edible animals). He said: Eat it if you wish, for it is considered legally slaughtered with the slaughtering of its mother
The testimony of a Bedouin against a city dweller is not permissible
The Messenger of Allah (may Allah's peace and blessings be upon him) issued judgments based on an oath and a witness

The Prophet (may Allah's peace and blessings be upon him) suggested to some people that they should take an oath. When they hurried to do so, he said that lots should be cast to decide which of them should take the oath
If anyone gets possession of a relative who is within the prohibited degrees (of marriage), that person becomes free
Safīnah said: I was Umm Salāmah’s slave, and she said: I will free you on condition that you serve the Messenger of Allah (may Allah's peace and blessings be upon him) for as long as you live
A slave who has entered into an agreement to purchase his freedom remains a slave as long as a dirham of the agreed price remains to be paid

If anyone leaves behind a debt or a helpless family, I shall be responsible. But if anyone leaves wealth, it goes to his heirs. I am the heir of him who has none, paying blood money on his behalf and inheriting from him. And a maternal uncle is the heir of him who has none, paying blood money on his behalf and inheriting from him
A newborn who cries after birth is entitled to inheritance
If the one passing in front of a person who is praying would know the gravity of his sin, it would have been better for him to stand for forty than to pass in front him

When anyone of you prays towards an object that acts as a barrier between him and the people and then someone tries to pass in front of him, he should push him away; and if he insists, he should fight him, for indeed he is a devil

The sun and the moon are two of the signs of Allah, by which Allah frightens His slaves. They do not eclipse on account of the death of anyone. So, when there is an eclipse, observe prayer and supplication till it (the eclipse) is over
I was commanded to prostrate on seven bones

Faith has over seventy branches or over sixty branches, the most excellent of which is the declaration that there is no god but Allah, and the lowest of which is the removal of what is harmful from the path; and modesty is a branch of faith

Umm Salama told the Messenger (may Allah's peace and blessings be upon him) about a church that she had seen in Ethiopia that had sculptures. He said: "If any righteous pious man dies amongst them, they build a place of worship above his grave and place those sculptures. They are the most evil creatures in the sight of Allah."

When one of you sneezes, he should say "alhamdu-lillāh" (praise be to Allah) and his brother or companion should say to him: "yarhamuk Allah" (may Allah have mercy on you). When he says so to him, the sneezer should reply: "yahdīkum Allah wa yuslih bālakum!" (may Allah guide you and grant you well being)
The reward of a man's prayer in congregation is twenty five times greater than that of the prayer he offers in his house or market
Whoever Allah saves from the evil of what is between his jaws and the evil of what is between his legs will enter Paradise
O mother of Hārithah, there are many ranks in the gardens of Paradise, and your son has attained Al-Firdaus
War is deception
Worship during times of turmoil is like emigration to me
O Allah, I ask You for guidance, piety, abstinence, and sufficiency

O Allah, to You I have submitted, and in You I have believed, in You I have put my trust, to You I have turned in repentance, and for You I have argued. O Allah, I seek refuge with Your power, there is no god but You, that You lead me astray. You are the Ever Living, the One who never dies, whereas the human beings and jinn will all die
Lands will be laid open for you, and Allah will spare you the fight. So, let none of you fail to play with his arrows
Fear Allah, pray your five, fast your month, give Zakah from your wealth, and obey your rulers, and you will enter your Lord's Paradise
No one has ever eaten food better than that which his hands have earned. Indeed, Prophet Dawūd (peace be upon him) used to eat from the earnings of his own hands
Do not say "Upon you be peace" for "Upon you be peace" is the greeting of the dead
The dutiful slave will be given a double reward
Whoever fasts a day for the sake of Allah, Allah will place between him and Hellfire a trench as wide as the distance between the heavens and earth
Whoever was taught shooting and then abandoned it does not belong to us - or has disobeyed
How can I be at ease when the one with the trumpet has put his lips to the trumpet waiting to hear the order to blow it?
If a slave is sincere to his master and worships Allah well, He will have a double reward
The tourism of my nation is Jihad in the path of Allah, the Exalted
You will receive seven hundred she-camels in return for it on the Day of Resurrection, all wearing bridles

The Messenger of Allah (may Allah's peace and blessings be upon him) used to start the prayer with Takbīr and then read: All praise is due to Allah, Lord of the worlds. When he bowed, he neither raised his head nor lowered it, but kept it in between
Allah loves the one who is pious, content, and restraint (humble)
When one of you eats, let him eat with his right hand, and when he drinks, let him drink with his right hand, for, indeed, the devil eats with his left hand and drinks with his left hand
May Allah curse the Jews and the Christians, they took the graves of their prophets as places of worship
Read the Qur’an, as it will come as an intercessor for its companions on the Day of Resurrection
O Allah, forgive my past and future sins, and my secret and open sins
O Allah, Lord of mankind, Remover of harm. Cure, You are the Curer. There is no curer but You. A cure that leaves behind no illness
Whoever performs ablution like this, his previous sins will be forgiven
Whoever performs the Fajr prayer will be under the protection of Allah

Paradise and Hellfire argued with each other (each claiming to be better than the other). Paradise said: The weak and poor will enter me. Hellfire said: The tyrants and arrogant will enter me. He said to Hellfire: You are My punishment with which I will exact revenge upon whomever I wish. Then He said to Paradise: You are My mercy with which I will show mercy to whomever I wish
The pain the martyr feels when being killed is no more than the pain any of you feels when being stung
Whoever keeps a horse in the cause of Allah, out of faith in Allah and believing in His promise, its food, water, dung, and urine will definitely be added to his scale on the Day of Resurrection
Whoever makes a contribution in the cause of Allah will have his reward seven-hundred times recorded to his credit

By the One in Whose hand Muhammad's soul is! I hope that you would be one-half of the inhabitants of Paradise; for none shall enter Paradise except a Muslim soul, and you, compared to the polytheists, are no more than a white hair on the skin of a black ox

While the Prophet (may Allah's peace and blessings be upon him) was on the pulpit, a man asked him: How should the night prayer be performed? He replied: In twos, and if any of you fear (the approach of) dawn, then let him pray one; that will make what he prayed an odd number
None of you should offer prayer in a single garment that does not cover the shoulders

Did the Messenger of Allah (may Allah's peace and blessings be upon him) asked forgiveness for you? He said: Yes, and for you, and he recited this verse: {And ask forgiveness for your sin and for the believing men and believing women} [Sūrat Muhammad: 19]
The dwellers of Paradise will see the upper abodes of Paradise as you see the stars in the sky

If Allah, the Almighty, loved the slave, He would call Jibrīl saying: Allah, the Almighty, loves so-and-so, O Jibrīl, love him. So Jibrīl would love him and then would make an announcement in the heavens: Allah loves so-and-so, therefore you should love him too. So all the dwellers of the heavens would love him, and then he would be granted the acceptance of people on earth

When the Messenger of Allah (may Allah's peace and blessings be upon him) made Takbīr, he would raise his hands up to the level of his ears. When he bowed, he would raise his hands up to the level of his ears, and when he raised his head from bowing and said: "Allah hears those who praise Him," he would do the same

One night, I prayed with the Prophet (may Allah's peace and blessings be upon him). He started (reciting) Sūrat al-Baqarah, so I said: Perhaps he will bow at the hundredth verse. But he continued. I said: Perhaps he will recite it all in one Rak‘ah. However, he continued. I said: Perhaps he will bow when he completes it. Then he started Sūrat An-Nisā' and recited it (all); then he started Sūrat Āl-‘Imrān and recited it (all), and he was reciting leisurely

It is a Sunnah for a man who marries a virgin when he already has a wife (who is no longer a virgin) that he stay seven nights with the new wife and then divide his overnight stay between both. If he marries a previously-married woman when he already has a wife (either a virgin or not), the Sunnah is for him to stay with her (the new wife) three nights and then divide his overnight stay between both
Whoever carries weapons against us is not one of us.
